page.title: 14Politics
page.content: Interview with the Chairman of the Parish Council. We asked Mr Jackson what being chairman meant. He answered "Being Chairman means conducting all the Council meetings and advising fellow Councillors on matters, also having the casting vote on all decisions. The Council exists by Act of Parliament and is a body of people representing the Parish to administer its affairs. Councillors are not paid. They are elected every three years by the residents of the village. A lot of work is involved, e.g. plans have to be discussed and the sites visited for observation. The local environment has to be protected and improved for the benefit of everyone. Since 1962 the population has risen from 200 to 1300 and this has caused problems.
